bio: Gobelins tapestry art - a world-famous brand of French decorative art - is made at the Manufacture des Gobelins, a famous tapestry factory named after a family of dyers and clothmakers who founded a dyestuffs business in the suburbs of Paris in the 15th century. It is best known for its role as the official supplier of tapestries and woven upholstery to the French court of the Sun King (le Roi-Soleil), Louis XIV (1638-1715), during the 17th century, although it retained its position as the leading tapestry manufactory in Europe throughout the 18th century and beyond.
